: : Wolfenstein/Diesel : : 
Wolfenstein: The same signature, huh? Could it be of some relation to you? 
Diesel sees that the energy ball would hit the base quickly, so he hits a few buttons on the computer. The deflector shield comes online, surronding the the ship and mountain that makes up the nWo base. Also the auto guns starts to fire at the energy ball, hopeing to stop it in the few seconds left.
The preceding has been paid for by the
New World Order
 "cardhead649 <cardhead649@...>" <cardhead649@...> wrote: Phoenix::

"Well, it seems familiar, but I just can't place it."  Phoenix sits 
up herself, still a bit woozy from the containment failure earlier.  
She glances around, then her voice drops to a whisper: "My spark is 
abnormal - extremely so.  And its signature matches the sensation I'm 
getting from ... whatever that is."

????????::

The unknown energy signature drops like a stone ... within seconds it 
will enter the base.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
> 
> : : Wolfenstein/Diesel/Razor : :
> Wolfenstein notices that Phoenix had awoken and was looking up at 
the ceiling.
> A proximity alarm sounds and Diesel checks it out on the computer.
> Diesel: Razor, I think you should look at this.
> The nWo Commander walks over to the computer and looks at the 
screen over Diesel's shoulder.
> Razor: Unknown energy signature headed this way. I dont know what 
this is, but let's be ready for something, brothers.
> As the nWo troops prepare for whatever is coming, Wolfenstein sits 
next to their prisoner.
> Wolfenstein: You know what that thing is dont you, Phoenix? Listen, 
I know that your a prisoner here and that the guys had some unplesent 
plans for you, but you can trust me. I dont want you hurt.
> The preceding has been paid for by the
> New World Order
>  "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:OOC: 
Anybody awake?  Some sort of answer from the nWo is in order ...
> 
> ????????::
> 
> The energy ball passes through the outer atmosphere, on a direct 
> course for the nWo base.  Exactly WHY it's headed there is a 
mystery 
> at the moment, but those moments are rapidly diminishing ...
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>" 
> <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > Phoenix::
> > 
> > Phoenix doesn't sleep for long, as a strange sensation jars her 
> > awake.  Groaning, she props herself up on one elbow and rubs her 
> head 
> > with the other hand.  Her attention seems fixed on (or rather 
> beyond) 
> > the ceiling.
> > 
> > ????????::
> > 
> > Somewhere beyond the moon, a shimmering vortex appears and a 
golden-
> > orange ball of pure energy comes out.  The vortex vanishes as 
> though 
> > it had never existed and the mysterious energy ball streaks 
toward 
> > the planet.
> > 
> > OOC: This will all make sense very soon - the mods will likely 
have 
> > an inkling already.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
> wrote:
> > > 
> > > : : Wolfenstein : :
> > > Wolf lowers Phoenix's sleeping form to the ground.
> > > Wolfenstein: I'm no doctor, but I think it's bad when your 
spark 
> is 
> > out of containment. Still, I think she'll be ok with sleep.
> > > The preceding has been paid for by the
> > > New World Order
> > >  "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:The 
> pain 
> > and the discharges gradually subside, and Phoenix, greatly 
> > > weakened, slumps into Wolfenstein's arms.  Her internal 
computer 
> > > chirps just loudly enough for Wolf to hear: "Spark containment 
re-
> > > established."
> > > 
> > > The femme shakes her head.  "It's been months since that's 
> > happened," 
> > > she says quietly.  "I was just starting to hope it had stopped 
> for 
> > > good."  She musters the strength to look over at 
Heartbreak.  "It 
> > > wasn't your fault."  Then her head droops as she slides into 
> stasis 
> > > lock.
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Hollywood Narrator" 
> > > <hollywood.narrator@v...> wrote:
> > > > Spider: Oh, come on you sissies!
> > > > 
> > > > He walks up.
> > > > 
> > > > Arrow: Spider, don't--
> > > > 
> > > > Spider: Quiet, Arrow, you need to learn a few things.
> > > > 
> > > > Spider grabs a nice firm grip on Phoenix's arm and vibrates 
> > around 
> > > with electricity crackling through his body. Deemos looks at 
> Arrow, 
> > > but looks away when Arrow doesn't look back. Spider's grip 
stayed 
> > > tight, however. After a few more seconds Spider's grip loosens 
> and 
> > he 
> > > is thrown backwards and into a wall. He falls to the floor and 
> > > twitches, still crackling with electricity.
> > > > 
> > > > Deemos: Well, she isn't dead.
> > > > 
> > > > Arrow's glare was on Phoenix, he never bothered to check 
> Spider's 
> > > condition...
> > > > 
> > > >   ----- Original Message -----
> > > >   From: Richard Allen

> > > > 
> > > >   After seeing Phoenix fall to her knees, and the odd energy 
> > appear 
> > > HBK takes a step back. 
> > > > 
> > > >   Heartbreak: I didn't do it, I swear! I didn't break our 
toy! 
> > > > 
> > > >   : : Wolfenstein : : 
> > > > 
> > > >   Wolf sees that something is wrong with Phoenix. What had 
they 
> > > done?! 
> > > > 
> > > >   He pushes past a few nWo members, including Heartbreak. He 
> > kneels 
> > > in front of Phoenix, but he did not touch her. 
> > > > 
> > > >   Wolfenstein: Phoenix, it's Wolf. What's wrong with you? Do 
> you 
> > > need help? 
> > > > 
> > > >   Wolfenstein didn't care if he was looking weak in front of 
> the 
> > > boys. He wanted to help her. He really hoped she could see that 
> he 
> > > meant no harm.
